title: Add frames for nexus 5x and nexus 6p.
F-Droid: No updates due to proprietary libraries
body:
Hey @f2prateek, I really enjoy your app, but what's up with you making heavy use of proprietary libraries? F-Droid actually _stopped_ updating your app (which is really bad), as stated on [your application page](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/com.f2prateek.dfg):

> This app will no longer be updated; Upstream started using proprietary libraries heavily.

If you did not know about this before, you should now consider fixing this a `PRIORITY` to not lose users!

title: File creation date far in the future
body:
Occasionally, the file creation date of images will be set in the year 47,890.

![screenshot_20151203-075735](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/837136/11556629/daa0fba4-999f-11e5-87f9-67eaa9280c2d.png)

I can't see any pattern to when this happens.  Most of the time the DFG images have the correct date.

Hardware: Nexus 6
OS: CM12.1(Lollipop) and CM13 (Marshmallow)
App version: 3.2.1

See also https://twitter.com/edent/status/598130142406410241

title: Use Toolbar and TabLayout from support library
Crop Edges on Blur
body: Most screenshots will have the status bar and the navigation bar that don't look so good in the background of the generated artwork. Idea is to crop the screenshot (when we downsample it) before blurring it to remove those visual artifacts.

title: Step through frame generation flow
body: With so many preferences, it's cumbersome to change them for one off images. Instead, we can launch a flow in the app that lets folks pick the options step by step and see the results in real time.

title: Refactor Preferences Activity
body: There's a lot of ugly state handling code in the Preferences Activity, let's clean it up before pushing to production.

title: Check links in the README document
body: Some of them are incorrect.

title: Programmatic Frame Generator Library
body:
I would like to automate the process through which screenshots are wrapped by interacting with the core of this app through a library.

The way I see it there's two approaches to accomplish this:
- Write a small, embeddable library which interacts with the application over intents, binder, et. al. in order to control it from within another application. This would require images be saved somewhere shareable and DFG would write the image back to the filesystem also in a shareable location.
- Extract the image manipulation core in to a library module. The main application and as well as a new library module would depend on this library. In this new library module a service would be included which runs in its own process (probably with `largeHeap=true`) for the processing. There would also be a lightweight API to interact with this service for enqueuing images and receiving callbacks when they were done processing.

I think there's value to doing it both ways but the former is probably the more reasonable approach.

There's some things to consider when interacting programmatically:
- What frame do you use? If not specified, the exact make should be used otherwise a generic frame that can be adjusted to the current device's specifications. Also an enum or string constants would be provided of shortnames for all the provided frames.
- Where do you write the images to? Instead of using the normal directory, the caller should be able to specify a target folder.
- What size is the generated image? Similar to #98, being able to reduce the size would be helpful for programmatic interaction.

title: Show Partial Devices
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: It's not obvious that users need to scroll to see more devices. Maybe we can have some peek out, or some indicator widget at the very least.

title: Add a Dimensions Class

title: Remove non-localized strings from values-cs, values-sk
body:
Such as 

```
  <string name="gplus_profile">+Prateek Srivastava</string>
  <string name="taylor_ling">Taylor Ling</string>
  <string name="twitter">\@f2prateek</string>
```

title: Drop BuildTypeBaseActivity
body: Use U2020's `DebugAppContainer` instead.

title: Use unique id's for saving default device
body:
Currently integers are used to save the position of the device in the list we have.

This is error prone, especially when new devices get added. We should switch to unique string ids (already provided by devices for resources), espcially when combined with #76

title: Evaluate Using Dagger's Set Bindings
body: Instead of using `DeviceProvider`, provide each device with set bindings.

title: Consolidate Modules
body: We can drop `AndroidModule` and cosnolidate those bindings into `DFGApplicationModule`.

Found the frames

https://android-review.googlesource.com/#/c/65515/

title: Slightly better build process
body:
Hello f2prateek,

My name is Daniel and I'm one of the F-Droid devs and maintainers. We've packaged your app for quite some time, thank you for making it free software!

I'd like to point out just two small improvements to the build process that you might want to consider:
- Using git tags.
- Not using github raw uris to master branches as maven dependency repos (hard to tell when they will be changed for something completely different, for example)

Thank you for your time!

title: Update version numbers, link to changelog and rename Issues to Bug
body: Tracker

title: Website
body: Add a website for the app. Also add a stubbed script to deploy the app for every update.

title: Show more message in Activity
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: When alive, the activity should display more progress messages including errors.

title: 4.3 Nexus7 "unknown error"
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: My Nexus 7 is on android 4.3,when Device Frame Generator is trying to save the image to gallery,I get "unknown error" and a grey image in the Device Frame Generator folder in my Gallery.

title: Touch feedback
body: closes #46

title: Better notifications
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: When generated from share, the existing notification system should be used, but when generated form within the app, the final image should be shown right away.

title: Add a Picture View Activity
body:
This drops the custom cache that I used originally in favor of Picasso. I'll probably bring that in again before release.

closes #38

title: Shorter name in portrait
body: Display "Frame Generator" in portrait on handsets, full name otherwise.

title: Touch indicators
body: Add a some touch feedback for the text.

title: Use Event bus for callbacks.
body: Use the event bus (see sample in tape) for callbacks for the task.

title: Better ForegroundImageView
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Improve https://github.com/f2prateek/Device-Frame-Generator/commit/368fbe1a8818a1e4f668bb138eddd0e4448f80a0

At the very least cache the value of the color used to indicate the selection.

For a more advanced improvement, add an ImageView that accepts a `foreground` attribute, so we can use the default system drawables.

For reference, see [Frame Layout](https://android.googlesource.com/platform/frameworks/base/+/refs/heads/master/core/java/android/widget/FrameLayout.java).

title: Better logging for exceptions
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: When the app catches an OOM, it should log some more additional information with bugsense that can help figure out to figure out the situations this happens in.

title: Kill the memory cache
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Based on chris's suggestion, I should probably kill the cache in https://github.com/f2prateek/Device-Frame-Generator/blob/368fbe1a8818a1e4f668bb138eddd0e4448f80a0/app/src/main/java/com/f2prateek/dfg/core/DeviceFrameGenerator.java#L46.

Although this will probably slow down the generation, by not keeping these in memory we could free up some memory for the larger images.

title: Evaluate tape support
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="question")]
body:
Now that I know how to use [tape](https://github.com/square/tape), I can think of adding support for it.

The critical part is how to handle exceptions. We should probably retry a couple of times with OOMs and then fail.

title: Dedicated picture viewer activity
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Add a dedicated image viewer activity, one that opens up automatically when done through the app, or as a click through from the notification.
Preferably with a white background. 

For a plus, back it with a multi touch capable ImageView such as https://github.com/chrisbanes/PhotoView

title: Build difficulties
body:
I've spent the last hours trying to build this for f-droid.org repository without luck. The error is `[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project com-f2prateek-dfg: Could not resolve dependencies for project com.f2prateek.dfg:com-f2prateek-dfg:apk:1.0.1: Failure to find android.support:compatibility-v4:jar:12 in http://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2 was cached in the local repository, resolution will not be reattempted until the update interval of central has elapsed or updates are forced -> [Help 1]
[ERROR] 
` 
My recipe is `Build Version:1.0.1,101,a262fd39bf,maven=yes,prebuild=\
mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=android.support -DartifactId=compatibility-v4 \
-Dversion=12 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=$$SDK$$/extras/android/support/v4/android-support-v4.jar && \
sed -i 's/debuggable=\"true\"/debuggable=\"false\"/g' app/AndroidManifest.xml && \
sed -i 's/app/dagger/g' pom.xml && \
sed -i 's/integration-tests/app/g' pom.xml && \
sed -i 's/<version>1.0-SNAPSHOT/<version>1.0.1/g' app/pom.xml && \
sed -i 's/<version>1.0-SNAPSHOT/<version>1.0.1/g' pom.xml && \
git clone https://github.com/square/dagger
`
Any ideas?

title: Otto Bus threading
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: figure out how this works so we can enable in-app notifications.

title: Update landscape UI
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Have a different UI that utilizes the space in landscape better. Use the same design from previous version of the app.

title: Drop Travis CI Support
body:
Don't use Travis CI. While it would require more verbose checkking fo merges, it has two advantages : 
1. Use of latest support library (NotificationCompat)
2. Use of Croutons.

title: Better Notifications when Generating Multiple Images
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Currently the app uses the same notification, just over-writes the old one. Would be better if a different service handled multiple notifications, showing a progress dialog.

title: Use resource quantifiers for thumbnails
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: This will make it even faster to load the thumbnails.

title: Parcelable Device
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: This means we don't have to rely on device numbers.

title: Help link broken
body:
By selecting "help" on the slide menu, throws an intent to a not existing GitHub pages.
![Screenshot_2013-01-19-15-33-37](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3306324/80319/78a22d36-6245-11e2-96bb-3933dffbc96d.png)

title: Wrong Resolution AT Nexus 7
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Since the latest update the resolution for Nexus 7 is wrong. There is always a green edge on the picture. 
![nexus_7_2012-12-24-12](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3115428/29744/cf8995f0-4dbc-11e2-8eb2-129105238b43.png)
![nexus_7_2012-12-24-11](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3115428/29745/d549bd9e-4dbc-11e2-9161-b2fc18e757bc.png)
